Utterance: <sigh>
Hi again! It’s great to see you back. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay, I guess. Just the usual ups and downs.
That’s understandable. Last time, you mentioned feeling unsure about your direction in life. Have you had any thoughts about that since we last spoke?
Yeah, a bit. I've been thinking about what I really want to do, but I'm still not sure.
It’s a big question. What kind of things have you been considering?
Well, I keep coming back to that idea of working outdoors, like being a forest ranger or something.
That sounds like a meaningful path. What draws you to that kind of work?
I just love nature, you know? Being outside makes me feel alive.
That’s wonderful. Have you looked into any opportunities or programs related to that?
A little. I’ve seen some volunteer programs, but I haven’t applied to anything yet.
What’s holding you back from applying?
I guess I’m just nervous about committing to something. What if I don’t like it?
That’s a valid concern. Have you thought about how you could explore that interest without fully committing right away?
Maybe I could do some short-term volunteering first?
That sounds like a great idea! It could give you a taste of what it’s like.
Yeah, I think I’d feel more comfortable with that.
How do you think you would feel if you tried it and didn’t enjoy it?
I’d probably feel disappointed, but I guess it would just mean I need to keep looking for what fits.
Exactly! It’s all part of the journey. What else have you been feeling uncertain about?
I think I’m also worried about making friends here in L.A.
That’s a common concern, especially in a new place. Have you had any opportunities to meet new people?
I’ve met a few people through classes, but it’s hard to connect deeply.
What do you think makes it difficult for you to connect?
I’m just naturally shy, I guess. It takes me a while to open up.
That makes sense. Would you like to explore some strategies to help ease that process?
Yeah, I’d be open to that.
One approach is to start with common interests. What are some things you enjoy that you could share with others?
I like drawing and music.
Those are great! Have you thought about joining a group or club around those interests?
I’ve seen some art classes and music meetups, but I haven’t gone to any yet.
What’s stopping you from attending?
Just the thought of being in a new group makes me anxious.
That’s understandable. How about setting a small goal, like attending just one class?
I think I could do that. Just one class to start.
That’s a fantastic plan! And remember, it’s okay to feel nervous. Everyone else there is likely feeling a bit out of their comfort zone too.
True. I hadn’t thought of it that way.
How do you typically handle those feelings of anxiety?
I usually just try to distract myself with music or drawing.
Those are healthy coping mechanisms. Have you tried any mindfulness techniques?
Not really. I’ve heard of them, but I don’t know how to start.
Mindfulness can be a great tool. Would you be interested in trying a simple breathing exercise together?
Sure, I’d like that.
Okay, let’s take a moment. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath in through your nose... and out through your mouth.
<inhales and exhales>
Great. Now focus on your breath. In... and out. Let any thoughts come and go without holding onto them.
<continues breathing>
How did that feel?
It felt nice. I feel a little more relaxed.
That’s wonderful! You can use this technique anytime you’re feeling anxious.
I’ll definitely try to remember that.
Is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now.
Alright, let’s set a goal for next time. How about you try that art class and practice the mindfulness exercise?
Sounds good! I’ll try to do both.
Great! I look forward to hearing how it goes.
Me too! Thanks for the help today.
You’re welcome! See you next time!
Bye!
Bye!
